text: Blessings for Obedience

“ ‘You\f + \fr 26:1 \ft Plural throughout the entire chapter \f* shall not make for yourselves idols and divine images, and you shall not raise up stone pillars for yourselves, and you shall not put a sculptured stone in your land in order to\f + \fr 26:1 \ft Or “to” \f* worship before it, because I \add am\add* Yahweh your God.
“ ‘You shall keep my Sabbaths, and you shall revere my sanctuary; I \add am\add* Yahweh.
“ ‘If you walk in my statutes and you keep my commands and you do them,
then\f + \fr 26:4 \ft Or “and” \f* I will give you rains in their time, and the land shall give its produce, and the trees of the field shall give their fruit.

And for you \add the\add* threshing season shall overtake \add the\add* grape harvest, and the grape harvest shall overtake \add the\add* sowing, and you shall eat your food ⸤to your fill⸥\f + \fr 26:5 \ft Literally “to contentment” \f* and you shall live ⸤securely⸥\f + \fr 26:5 \ft Literally “with confidence” \f* in your land.

And I will give peace in the land, and you shall lie down, and there shall not be ⸤anybody who makes you afraid⸥,\f + \fr 26:6 \ft Literally “who makes afraid” or “making afraid” \f* and I will remove harmful animals from the land, and ⸤no sword shall pass through your land⸥.\f + \fr 26:6 \ft Literally “a sword shall not pass through in your land” \f*
And you shall pursue your enemies, and they shall fall by the sword ⸤before you⸥.\f + \fr 26:7 \ft Literally “to your faces” \f*

And five of\f + \fr 26:8 \ft Hebrew “from” \f* you shall pursue a hundred, and a hundred of\f + \fr 26:8 \ft Hebrew “from” \f* you shall pursue a myriad;\f + \fr 26:8 \ft Or “ten thousand” \f* and your enemies shall fall by the sword ⸤before you⸥.\f + \fr 26:8 \ft Literally “to your faces” \f*
And I will turn to you, and I will make you fruitful, and I will make you numerous; and I will keep my covenant with you.

And you shall eat ⸤old grain⸥,\f + \fr 26:10 \ft Literally “old what is stale” \f* and ⸤you shall clear away the old before the new⸥.\f + \fr 26:10 \ft Literally “old from the faces of new you shall bring out” \f*
And I will put my dwelling place in your midst, and my inner self\f + \fr 26:11 \ft Or “soul” \f* shall not abhor you.
And I will walk about in your midst, and I shall be your God,\f + \fr 26:12 \ft Or “as a God for you” \f* and you shall be my people.\f + \fr 26:12 \ft Or “as a people for me” \f*
I \add am\add* Yahweh, your God who brought you out from the land of Egypt, from being their slaves; and I broke the bars of your yoke, and I caused you to walk erectly.
Punishment for Disobedience
“ ‘But\f + \fr 26:14 \ft Or “And” \f* if you do not listen to me and you do not carry out\f + \fr 26:14 \ft Or “you do not do” or “you do not observe” or “you do not perform” \f* all these commands,

and if you reject my statutes and if your inner self\f + \fr 26:15 \ft Or “soul” \f* abhors my regulations, to not carry out\f + \fr 26:15 \ft Or “do” or “observe” or “perform” \f* all my commands \add by\add* your breaking my covenant,

I ⸤in turn⸥\f + \fr 26:16 \ft Literally “also” or “indeed” \f* will do this to you: then\f + \fr 26:16 \ft Or “and” \f* I will summon onto you horror, the wasting disease, and the fever that wastes eyes and that drains away life; and you shall sow your seed ⸤in vain⸥,\f + \fr 26:16 \ft Literally “for the emptiness” \f* and your enemies shall eat it.

And I will set my face against you, and you shall be defeated ⸤before⸥\f + \fr 26:17 \ft Literally “to the faces of” \f* your enemies; and your haters shall rule over you, and you shall flee away, but\f + \fr 26:17 \ft Or “and” \f* there shall not be ⸤anybody who is pursuing⸥\f + \fr 26:17 \ft Literally “who pursues” or “pursuing” \f* you.
“ ‘And if in spite of these \add things\add* you do not listen to me, then\f + \fr 26:18 \ft Or “and” \f* I will continue to discipline you seven times for your sins.
And I will break the pride of your strength; and I will make your heaven like iron\f + \fr 26:19 \ft Or “iron ore” \f* and your land like copper.
And your strength shall be consumed ⸤in vain⸥;\f + \fr 26:20 \ft Literally “to the emptiness” \f* and your land shall not give its produce, and the land’s trees shall not give their fruit.
“ ‘And if you go against me \add in\add* hostility and you are not willing to listen to me, then\f + \fr 26:21 \ft Or “and” \f* I will add a plague onto you seven times according to your sins.

And I will send ⸤wild animals⸥\f + \fr 26:22 \ft Literally “the animals of the field” \f* out among you, and they shall make you childless, and they shall cut down your domestic animals, and they shall make you fewer; and your roads shall be desolate.
“ ‘And if you do not accept correction from\f + \fr 26:23 \ft Hebrew “for” or “to” \f* me through these \add things\add*, but\f + \fr 26:23 \ft Or “and” \f* you go against me \add in\add* hostility,

then\f + \fr 26:24 \ft Or “and” \f* I myself\f + \fr 26:24 \ft Emphatic personal pronoun \f* will also go against you in hostility, and I myself\f + \fr 26:24 \ft Emphatic personal pronoun \f* also will strike you seven times for your sins.

And I will bring upon you a sword that seeks vengeance \add for the\add* covenant, and you shall be gathered to your cities; and I will send a plague in your midst, and you shall be given into \add the\add* hand of an enemy.

At my breaking \add the\add* ⸤supply⸥\f + \fr 26:26 \ft Literally “staff” \f* of bread\f + \fr 26:26 \ft Or “food” \f* for you, then\f + \fr 26:26 \ft Or “and” \f* ten women shall bake your bread in one oven, and they shall return your bread by weight; and you shall eat \add it\add*, and you shall not be satisfied.
“ ‘And if through this you do not listen to me and you go against me in hostility,

then\f + \fr 26:28 \ft Or “and” \f* I will go against you in hostile anger, and also\f + \fr 26:28 \ft Or “surely” \f* I myself\f + \fr 26:28 \ft Emphatic personal pronoun \f* will discipline you seven times for your sins.
And you shall eat the flesh of your sons; and the flesh of your daughters you shall eat.
And I will destroy your high places, and I will cut down your incense altars, and I will place your corpses on your idols’ corpses; and my inner self\f + \fr 26:30 \ft Or “soul” \f* shall abhor you.

And I will lay your cities \add in\add* ruins, and I will lay waste your sanctuaries; and I shall not smell your \add sacrifices’\add*\f + \fr 26:31 \ft Implied by the use of the same phraseology in regard to the sacrifices in the early chapters of the book \f* appeasing fragrance.
And I myself\f + \fr 26:32 \ft Emphatic personal pronoun \f* will lay waste the land, and your enemies who are living in it shall be appalled over it.
And I will scatter you among the nations, and I will draw a sword behind you; and your land shall be a desolation, and your cities shall be a ruin.
Then the land shall enjoy its Sabbaths all the days of its lying desolate, and you \add shall be\add* in the land of your enemies; then the land shall rest, and it shall enjoy its Sabbaths.
All the days of its lying desolate it shall rest \add for the time\add*\f + \fr 26:35 \ft Implied by context \f* that it had not rested during your Sabbaths while you were living on it.

As for\f + \fr 26:36 \ft Or “And” \f* the ones who remain among you, I will bring\f + \fr 26:36 \ft Or “and I will bring” \f* fearfulness in their hearts in the land of their enemies; and a sound of a windblown leaf shall pursue them, and they shall flee \add like\add* flight ⸤before⸥\f + \fr 26:36 \ft Literally “of” \f* a sword, and they shall fall, but\f + \fr 26:36 \ft Or “and” \f* there shall not be a pursuer.

And they shall stumble over ⸤one another⸥\f + \fr 26:37 \ft Literally “a man on his brother” \f* as ⸤from before⸥\f + \fr 26:37 \ft Literally “from the faces of” \f* a sword, but\f + \fr 26:37 \ft Or “and” \f* there shall not be a pursuer; and ⸤you shall have no resistance⸥\f + \fr 26:37 \ft Literally “it shall not be for you resistance” \f* ⸤before⸥\f + \fr 26:37 \ft Literally “to the faces of” \f* your enemies.
And you shall perish among the nations, and the land of your enemies shall eat you.

And because of their guilt, the ones among you who remain shall decay in the land of their enemies; and also because of the iniquities of their ancestors,\f + \fr 26:39 \ft Or “fathers” \f* they shall decay with them.

“ ‘But\f + \fr 26:40 \ft Or “And” \f* when they confess their guilt and the guilt of their ancestors\f + \fr 26:40 \ft Or “fathers” \f* in their infidelity that they displayed against me, and moreover that they went against me in hostility—

I myself\f + \fr 26:41 \ft Emphatic personal pronoun \f* also\f + \fr 26:41 \ft Or “surely” \f* went against them in hostility, and I brought them into the land of their enemies—or \add if\add* then their uncircumcised heart is humbled and then they pay for their guilt,

I will remember\f + \fr 26:42 \ft Or “and I will remember” \f* my covenant \add with\add* Jacob; and I will remember also my covenant \add with\add* Isaac and also my covenant \add with\add* Abraham, and I will remember the land.

And the land shall be deserted by them, and it shall enjoy its Sabbaths in its being desolate from them, and they themselves\f + \fr 26:43 \ft Emphatic personal pronoun \f* must pay for their guilt, ⸤simply because⸥\f + \fr 26:43 \ft Literally “because and in because” \f* they rejected my regulations, and their inner self\f + \fr 26:43 \ft Or “soul” \f* abhorred my statutes.

And ⸤in spite of⸥\f + \fr 26:44 \ft Literally “also even” or “moreover also” or “moreover even” \f* this, ⸤when they are⸥\f + \fr 26:44 \ft Literally “in their being” \f* in the land of their enemies I will not reject them, and I will not abhor them to destroy them, to break my covenant with them, because I \add am\add* Yahweh their God.

And I will remember \add the\add* first covenant for them\f + \fr 26:45 \ft Or “on behalf of them” or “on their behalf” \f*—whom I brought out from the land of Egypt ⸤in the sight of⸥\f + \fr 26:45 \ft Literally “to the eyes of” or “for the eyes of” \f* the nations ⸤to be their God⸥.\f + \fr 26:45 \ft Literally “to be for them for God” or “to be for them as a God” \f* I \add am\add* Yahweh.’ ”

These are the rules and the regulations and the laws that Yahweh gave between himself and the ⸤Israelites⸥\f + \fr 26:46 \ft Literally “sons/children of Israel” \f* on ⸤Mount Sinai⸥\f + \fr 26:46 \ft Literally “the mountain of Sinai” \f* ⸤through⸥\f + \fr 26:46 \ft Literally “in/by the hand of” \f* Moses.
